alert.note: Alert for Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Middle Tanana Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 03 at 2:38PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...Rising Water Levels and Ice Jam Potential on Interior Rivers... Spring breakup process continues in the Middle Tanana Valley and across the Interior. Warm temperatures last week and over the weekend have produced significant melting of the snowpack. The snow pack melt off water is rapidly making its way into the waterways of the Interior. Rivers and stream around the Interior continue to show significant rises on the gages that are not ice effected. The Chena River is mainly open up to the 40 mile bridge on Chena Hot Springs Road. The Chena, Little Chena, Salcha, Chatanika,Tanana, GoodPaster and Nenana rivers are all forecasted to rise over the next several days. Residents along these rivers should prepare for rising water levels with with possible inundation of low low lying areas. Significant ice remains on the Upper Chena and portions of the Little Chena and Tanana Rivers. Local ice jams have been reported on the Chena River upstream of Hunts Cabin with local inundations in low lying areas near the river. Rising water levels could lift the ice at any time and move in sheets with the potential for ice dams to form. Residents should be vigilant if they are near rivers and streams and watch for rapidly rising water. Significant overflow continues on many of the waterways in the Interior. Local ponding of water in the urban areas will continue to be an issue. For the latest river information go to www.weather.gov/aprfc.

area.areaDesc: Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Middle Tanana Valley
